title: Incorrect raw identifier variable name help suggestion

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Incorrect hint for variable with a similar name defined using raw identifiers
```rust
fn main() {
    let r#final = 1;
    r#fina;
}

```

([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=6214770563a002ca14cd236cc19f14c0))

Errors:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0425]: cannot find value `fina` in this scope
 --> src/main.rs:3:5
  |
3 |     r#fina;
  |     ^^^^^^ help: a local variable with a similar name exists: `final`

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0425`.
error: could not compile `playground`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.

```

Should be `help: a local variable with a similar name exists: r#final`
